sentences.en: A signpost indicated the right road for us to follow.
sentences.cn: 路标指给我们应走的路.

sentences.en: A signpost with variable number of signs that you can lengthen or shorten.
sentences.cn: 标志数量可变的标志柱,您可以将其加长或缩短.

sentences.en: I’m sure that signpost is pointing the wrong way.
sentences.cn: 我敢肯定那块路标指错了方向。

sentences.en: If the application has a toolbar, It'should also be considered a recognizable signpost.
sentences.cn: 如果程序有工具栏, 那么也应该将其当做可识别的标志.

sentences.en: Just follow the signposts to the city centre.
sentences.cn: 就按路标所指的方向去市中心。

sentences.en: Make a signpost where the road branches off to the city.
sentences.cn: 又要定出一条路,使刀来到犹大的坚固城耶路撒冷.

sentences.en: The lights of the car lit up a signpost.
The man set the boy on his way until he reached the signpost.
sentences.cn: 这人一直把孩子送到路标跟前.

sentences.en: The signpost points in a westerly direction.
The village isn’t very well signposted.
sentences.cn: 这个村子在路标上指示得不是很清楚。

sentences.en: This signpost tells the way to New York.
sentences.cn: 这个路标指示前往纽约的路.

sentences.en: This signpost tells the way to the zoo.
sentences.cn: 这个路标说明去动物园的道路.

sentences.en: Turn off at the signpost for Attlebridge.
sentences.cn: 在路标处拐弯去往阿特尔桥。

sentences.en: We drove past a signpost I couldn't read.
sentences.cn: 我们驶过一块路标,可是我读不懂.

trans.tran_en: a sign at the side of a road showing directions and distances

trans.tran_cn: 设置路标,介绍（论证、讲话等的）要点
